title: Allow parsing of AsId from a number.
body: RFC6492 demands that AS resources are specified as decimals. I.e. without the "AS" prefix.

title: Support re-use of sigobj.rs for RFC6492 and RFC8181 protocol CMS
body:
Marking some thing pub, so that they can be used for RPKI protocol (RFC6492) and (RFC8181) CMS messages by code in Krill.

Note we may want to port this code in krill to rpki-rs in future. Once it's stable and tested.

title: Certificate sign request
body: Support parsing, validating, and constructing Certificate Sign Requests (CSR) used in the RFC6492 RPKI provisioning protocol.

title: Subtract a Duration from a Time.
Fix BER encoding of resources::Prefix.
body: Fixes an issue where the number of unused bits was calculated wrongly in the encoding of IP address prefixes.

title: Serialization of some X.509 types.
body: This add serialization to `rpki::x509`’s `Serial`, `Time`, and `Validity` types. It also adds it to `KeyIdentifier` but moves it to `rpki::crypto::keys` as well.

title: enable nightly for CI/CD and speedups
body: bring building modalities in sync with nlnetlabs/routinator#151 by building for nightly while allowing failures and caching cargo

title: Make CRL Next Update mandatory as in RFC5280 section 5.1.2.5.
Add convenience functions for creating Time.
body: Useful when generating certificates, manifests etc.

title: Serialize rpki objects
body: Serialize and deserialize rpki objects (cert, manifest, roa and crl)

title: Correctly encode Serial with most significant bit set.
Revised handling of Certificates, CRLs, and all Signed Objects.
Serialize, Deserialize, and format AsResources, Ipv4Resources and Ipv6Resources
body:
Note: this is particularly useful for the Krill project where we need to persist
resources associated with Certificate Authorities.

I introduced the explicit implementations for Ipv4Resources and Ipv6Resources, in addition to IpResources and the (shortlived) IpBlocksForFamily for convenience: it allows for a straightforward Display and FromStr that can be used when (De)Serializing.

title: Implement serde traits for URI types.
Add FromStr- and Display-like facilities to IP resources.
Verify content types of ROAs and manifests.
Drop Fail and derive Display via derive_more.
Encode signed objects
body: Merge will be delayed until after the 0.3.0 release.

title: Add is_stale methods to Manifest and Crl.
Alternative resource overclaim handling as per RFC 8360.
Add a certificate builder.
body: This adds a new certificate builder that can construct and sign a certificate. It has been confirmed working for TA certificates.

title: Publication protocol support
body: Contains a number of changes to support the publication protocol. Generating and validating signed messages and such. This should be additions, so I don't expect that this will break anything depending on 0.2.0

title: Allow CRLs to cache the list of serials.
Add TAL information to origin information.
body: This PR adds a new type `TalInfo` which currently only contains the name of the TAL but may have more information added later. A pointer to it (via an arc) is kept during validation in `ResourceCert` and is ultimately added to `RouteOriginAttestation`s. The latter keep it via a new `RoaStatus` field that is the first step towards the ability to keep invalid ROAs for statistical purposes.

title: Relaxed and strict validation for subject and issuer.
Generate id cert
body: Would like to merge this and then continue work on making a signed CMS message for the protocol messages. I.e. create an IdCert EE, CMS, sign, verify, etc. So some refactoring is bound in that context.

title: Publication protocol -XML
body: Parsing and generating all RFC8181 XML messages

title: Repository response
body: Just testing the happy case (no corner case XML files etc), but it should work and follows the same pattern as the previous file. But have a look at the uri::Http implementation.

title: Start of out of band work
body:
Parses a <publisher_request> XML message and validates the included TA certificate.

So, added basic support for handling XML and Identity Certificates that will be useful for the next things that are needed for supporting the publication (and later provisioning) protocol. This stuff is in rpki-rs because both the publication server and the CA implementations will have to use this.
